headline.main: Two Studies Link Smoking and Colon Cancer

docs.lead_paragraph: Two studies involving more than 160,000 people show that cigarette smoking can lead to colon cancer in both men and women, the strongest evidence yet of a connection. The parallel studies, to be published on Wednesday in The Journal of the National Cancer Institute, also found that early smoking apparently increases the risk of colorectal cancer for life, even if a smoker quits.
